name: Portfolio
tagline: A selection of projects I like to work on.
body:
# 
# I'm Derek Miller
I turn business problems into math problems, then I solve them with code and design. I'm an scientist by day, designer by night. I have experience with data visualization, creative writing, and museum exhibit design. Well-designed objects and spaces make the world a better place. My background is in math, stats, and economics. Currently working as a course developer and instructor for a class on analytical visualization and exploratory data analysis, a Junior Data Scientist for Meter Group, and a student in Applied and Computational Mathematics.

Check out [my portfolio](http://github.com/dgmiller/portfolio) of projects on GitHub.

## Posts on Medium

[Data centric vs Model centric Science](https://medium.com/@derekgunthermiller/data-centric-vs-model-centric-e8f163a1d24d#.djic0dc7t)

[Don't Gamble at College](https://medium.com/@derekgunthermiller/if-you-want-to-gamble-dont-do-it-at-college-d1b0a6ed12fe#.qg1ll9bv2)

## Favorite Books

**Thinking Fast and Slow** by Daniel Kahneman

**The Information** by James Gleick

**Weapons of Math Destruction** by Cathy O'Neil

**Moby-Dick** by Herman Melville

**Zero to One** by Peter Thiel and Blake Masters

**Creative Confidence** by Tom Kelley and David Kelley

**Moneyball** by Michael Lewis



### Things I like from around the web

[Data Visualization of Classic Literature](https://www.behance.net/thesarahkay)

[Visualizing Numerical Optimization Algorithms](http://www.benfrederickson.com/numerical-optimization/)

[Designing Dialogue YouTube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dxOECOtYeZc)



#### Contact
